author: thomas.langlois
title: Cardanobi.io
description: There's a great deal of value locked in the data processed by Cardano and its ecosystem. How to extract it and make it available to all?

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal tries to build an open-source Business Intelligence API Layer on top of Cardano. If successfully implemented this will add value to the Cardano ecosystem. From each section, the proposal has provided a thorough plan to achieve their goals and ambitions. Overall this is a well-written proposal and the team has a great chance to work out the plan. The proposal gives two main potential risks, funding and marketing, however, the team has a plan to mitigate both risks.
f6_assessments.q1: This part of the proposal is very complete and well-written. The proposal has clear milestones defined by 5 EPICs, each with distinct features. The proposal also provides a roadmap to working on the stated milestones. In the first months, 3 months, 6 months, and 12 months, each of them has specific features to be completed on. The team provides a detailed and reasonable breakdown of how they will use the proposed budget, from remuneration for the developers (with a very reasonable rate), the cost for the server, to the contingency fund. The proposal gives concise information of background, and position of each team member on the project, they also provide the LinkedIn profile to each member, the LinkedIn profiles made the community easily verify they are giving funds to a legitimate team.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal clearly defined 4 KPIs on each sprint to track the project progress, that is velocity, predictability, Stakeholders satisfaction, and people satisfaction. The proposal also provides clear deliverables as indicators of success each on a specific timeframe, on the 12th month gives clear goals of more than 10K+ API queries a day.

f6_assessments.q0:
I strongly agree that this proposal addresses the challenge very well and will bring in a lot of value to the Cardano open source ecosystem. The proposal identifies that there is a lot of value in the on-chain data that Cardano will process and as the number of Dapps launching on Cardano are increasing week by week, it is a no-brainer that the on-chain analytics will be of utmost importance for various purposes.

Being myself in IT industry as an Engineer for over 15 years I have closely followed the big tech giants (e.g. Google, Amazon and Meta) work on data analytics to predict various trends and then build data models, bringing significant profits and steer solutions to not only find solutions to some of the difficult business problems but also identify new business opportunities (especially to the untapped customer areas). 

Given the nature of blockchain the data analytics combined with Cardano may give even better results, because the immutable nature of blockchain brings true data integrity which is usually a big issue when dealing with data analytics on otherwise centralized servers. Therefore, such data analytics on Cardano can be leveraged by various Cardano projects which are looking to find solutions to specific business problems in their business domains.

The proposal proposes to open source both front end and back end, and hence perfectly aligns with the target for this challenge. The API solution that this proposal proposes will make it very easy for any project/dapp on Cardano to simply build their own AI based or data driven services based on the analytics provided by this API. Finally, with my own development experience I can say that microservices based architecture is a very good candidate to have good scalability with minimal set of changes (if done right), and I hope that team will be able to do so in the right way. Therefore, I strongly agree that this proposal, if implemented successfully, will bring a lot of benefits to the Cardano open source dev ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1:
Firstly, I would like to mention that this proposal was approved but because of lack of funding was not able to get funded in the previous round. The budget breakdown is very justified. I have myself designed microservices based architectures for enterprise businesses, and therefore I can easily judge that team knows what they are going to deliver and how much effort they estimate in terms of budget requirements.

The proposal has provided public links to the main developers/leads who will be driving this project. Since they will use db sync and build up their API layer ground up, I do not really see any need to have smart contract development experience here, which is otherwise lacking on the team side. Also the team does a great job in explaining the architectural details of the proposed solution such as OAuth 2.0 /open id connect for user authorization protecting the API endpoints. 

The timeline is very well represented, and rates of every developer are split into man hours. The timeline is split into 1-3-6-12 months. Each of these timeline presents a good set of descriptions on feature sets that are expected to be released in those months. 

I really like that the proposal has considered contingency plans in terms of over budgeting , which addresses one of the challenge settings of having a verifiable plan in case of such situations. Additionally, even though a lesser risk section on marketing for driving adoption is given, in my opinion is NOT a lesser risk when it comes to the impact of this proposal, however, for the scope of completion/feasibility of this project I agree that this would be a comparatively less risk. An overall, very well explained and elaborated proposal, hence I strongly agree.
f6_assessments.q2:
The roadmap of this project is provided in detail. The team has already identified the number of epics for this project, which means they are going to work in an Agile based environment. These epics are further split into features that can be expected per Epic. Also, the team will provide details of their progress on Github, which can then easily be tracked by the community as these features are worked upon and rolled out.

The time horizon that connects these epics together is also provided, which means that it is already planned out that at the end of the given timeline (1-3-6-12 months) which features from which epic are to be expected. 

What I also admire is that the team has given a very detailed peek into what actual work in terms of implementation they would be doing at which stage of this project. As a senior developer myself I can assert that this is a very good sign as it explains a lot about the professionalism and technical expertise of the proposal team. I, therefore, fully agree that this proposal is highly auditable. Good luck to the team this time.

f6_assessments.q0: An open-source API layer on top of Cardano would bring a lot of useful information about the blockchain for general masses that are building on Cardano. They’ve explained on what their solution does, with a comprehensive description about the benefits if this project is realized. However, there seems to be lack of information about why it is important to build an open-source Business Intelligence API Layer on Cardano, other than “..a great deal of value locked in the the data processed by Cardano and its ecosystem”, and asking “How to extract it and make it available to all?”. This pretext isn’t sufficient enough to justify their importance. An improvement would be to explain how the current developer ecosystem is struggling with such limitation (absence of open-source Business Intelligence API layer). A reference would be from addressing such problem in these twitter conversation, about performance and latency issues, then write an argument from that to justify this proposal: https://twitter.com/adatainment/status/1506958405033943043?s=20&t=hQWorTSW7-7Yc5HsbdYjEg (I have to point out that these conversation only happened after the proposal submission deadline is passed, so take this only for an example). All in all, it’s a well written proposal, in terms of how well the proposer able to explain in great details about their solution and benefit for this solution.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal have explained their plan in detail, comprehensive, and very well written; defined every phase (EPIC) from API definition, how they’ve will do it, the API implementation, etc. Cardanobi.io team consist of experienced people in the industry, and it’s relevant for this project to succeed. They’ve provided the goals and milestones for each month (1 month, 3 month, 6 month) complete with timelines, which further indicate that the team have a solid plan and knowledge on what to expect about their implementation details. Their budget breakdown is also provided in great detail, from people salary to resource cost (server, infrastructure, etc.). Overall, a comprehensive and well written proposal which include all the information necessary for this project to succeed.
f6_assessments.q2: Roadmap and milestone is presented in great detail, not only setting the timeline but also the expected outcome and goals for each timeframe (1 month, 3 month, and 6 month). The KPIs is well defined with brief description of what it is; velocity, predictability, etc. Tracking their progress is also possible through Github repo that they provide. Overall, this would be a transparent project and able to be publicly audit.
